about_the_game:
This Season pass contains:


  • The Beekeeping DLC
  • The Additional Characters DLC

And the upcoming URBAN AGRICULTURE DLC

This expansion will be set in the outskirts of a city, where you will be able to grow a variety of produce (vegetables, fruits, edible flowers and salads) on buildings, parks, and green spaces.
Please note that the following features are still in progress and may differ at release

  • A 4 to 5 stories interactive building with a vegetable garden on the roof (tray system).
  • At the bottom of your building, access to a basement is available to grow plants or salads thanks to diodes.
  • Smaller buildings around the interactive one.
  • A large collaborative vegetable garden, which can mix tray and soil cultivation. The profitability of this vegetable garden depends on its productivity and educational visits.
  • Another garden focused on “leisure”. It is a social hub, the goal is not to be productive. The objectives on this plot are to facilitate its access, to find partnerships, and to keep the plot in good condition.
  • A wasteland space, which can be improved in multiple ways: in green space/ park or even upgradable into housing for the population.
  • Living in the urban environment:

A lively city, added traffic, cyclists, pedestrians. Volunteers in vegetable gardens. Pigeons.
This scenario moves away from our previous livestock farms, and is largely based on volunteerism.
New features in some systems (such as the Team menu, victory criteria, subsidies, the market, etc.) are to be expected

BUY A DLC = SAVE THE BEES


Because Roots of Tomorrow is a game about agroecology, it was important to us to support the preservation of biodiversity.

This is why part of the income generated by the sales these DLCs will be donated to the non profit “Un toit pour les abeilles” (“A roof for bees”)

“Un Toit Pour Les Abeilles” is a network of nearly a hundred beekeepers who campaign for artisanal, local and bee-friendly beekeeping. For more than 10 years, the beekeepers of the network have been committed to safeguarding the bee, in particular through the sponsorship of beehives.
